Replies.Reply: Excuse me sir, can we help you?
Did you miss your ride?
Yes, I'm afraid you did. Can we call someone for you?
Did you come with the folks from the retirement home?
Let's go inside and we can call them to pick you up.
I got it Russ. Take the walker.
You sound like you know circuses.
Malcolm, tell them to come through!
Two circuses. Wow, that's something.
I'll need your name when I call the home.
What years?
for the---?
I don't believe this. After the Hartford Fire and the Hagenback-
Charlie O'Brien the third.
Mr. Jankowski, I would be honored if you would have a drink with me in my trailer.
Camels drink scotch?
You really got here on you're own?
I should call the home, let them know where you are.
So, how did the Benzini Brothers stampede start? The story is two guys got thrown off the train and--
Sorry. From the beginning.
It's the heat.
Hi Officer, can I help you?
We had a lot of folks from the home today. But no, I haven't seen him.
He can't talk. Had a major stroke a few years back. But he's doing well. Ain't ya Pop?
I missed the Spec.
Where'd it all go?
No, I came on my own.
No, I told ya, I came on my own and I'm not going back. Get your hands off me.
Why don't you pick some of those rings out ya head maybe you won't be so stupid, ya dumb little shit.
In my day, they had old timers in the ticket wicket and freaks like him in the sideshow. Damn kid didn't even know what the Spec was.
I should. I was on two.
I was in the middle of it.
Jacob Jankowski the only.
The Great Escape! But I got lost.
No point in telling a story if all you want to know is the end.
It was a big day. My final exams.
No. Just me.
But I'm telling you, my father put away every penny he ever earned.
And so he's penalized for not turning away people who couldn't afford his help? He was a doctor.
I didn't believe the lawyer or the bank. My mother worked. They had savings. We were never broke. So why would they need a mortgage?
They did it to pay for my Ivy League education.
Like I'd been sleepwalking and I woke up. I had no idea where I was.
Jacob. Jankowski. Nice to meet you.
No. Nothing like that.
I don't know.
About anything I guess.
Who's that?
What is it? What do you want?
You're welcome, ma'am.
Do I call him Crazy Joe?
I've never seen so much manure!
How do you stand the smell?
Excuse me, ma'am? Hi. I'm Jacob.
May I? He may be foundering.
He should be all right for tonight.
You never saw anything like it. You could hardly take it all in without fearing you might go blind from the shine. From one kind of world too hard to bear came some kind a heaven no one knew existed.
And then just as quickly, heaven was packed away and gone.
But it's the middle of the night.
Hey Camel - who's that woman who works the horses?
Wife?
I don't.
I don't know how to thank you.
Do I look OK?
Jacob Jankowski, sir.
Just looking for work, sir.
No sir.
No sir.
Ringling Brothers.
Yes. But it was terrible.
I would do that, sir. I'd like to work with the animals.
It was veterinary science! And I can tell you one thing - that Star Attraction horse of yours won't be walking in a few days let alone performing center ring!!
Cornell.
I hear Ringling has its own vet.
I believe so.
JESUS CHRIST!
How do you do?
A Jack Russell. They're very smart.
See ya Camel.
Monday Man?
He takes other people's clothes?
August, it's all right, I'll--
August..
Thank you for everything, August.
Yes, August?
It's a pleasure to meet you.
Not yet.
August, this stuff has gone off. Do the cats really eat this?
What do I do, just open the door and toss it in?
What the hell is wrong with you?
FUN! I could have lost my arm!
I don't know how he's been performing August, but you don't have a Star Act now. That horse can't walk and if he does you'll lose him. He's in a lot of pain.
You'll lose him anyway. I'm sorry.
It's the right thing to do.
If I'm the show's vet then it's my decision, isn't it?
Then it'll be my last decision.
I need a gun.
I need a gun! Or a rifle! Now!
Shut-up! Both of you!
You should go.
Friends now?
My father used to say that to me.
How is Marlena?
Tell Diamond Joe the animals need more water when the humidity's this bad if I don't see him before I go.
What problem?
What does Silver Star have to do with the cats?
August, what did you do? August?
The train wheels screech as it begins to stop. Jacob rises and looks out of open train car doors..
Why are we stopping?
What happened to this circus?
A bull?
She has such long eye lashes.
Mrs. Rosenbluth, I hope I'm not speaking out of turn here but - but I had no idea they were going to do that to Silver Star.
Hello Rosie, I'm Jacob Jankowski.
You're a beauty, huh. Skin's a little dry, you oughta take care of that. First thing you notice about a woman's age is her skin.
Jacob and Marlena laugh, her mood lightened because of Jacob.
I'm confessin that I love you.
What is it?
I admit he has his moments of insanity but he's really a very generous, charming guy.
Why are they beating him?
I'm not dressed for champagne.
Of course I do, August. You've been nothing but swell to me.
I have to tell you something. You may not trust me after you hear it.
I never took my final exams at Cornell. I'm not a real vet.
But it's true. I never got my degree. I'm not a licensed vet.
Not about this, August.
No.
To Rosie!
He looked like a different man when he looked at her. I said to myself, maybe love does that to a man. I didn't know much about it.
Is everything all right?
Tonight was your idea?
You said that.
Is that all right?
What happened at 17?
He was pretty lucky to find you.
Pretty song.
Oh no Marlena, I won't ever tell.
I have no idea.
Where's that?
I'm not that sweet.
BRAVA QUEENIE! BRAVA!
Where am I?
Where are my clothes? I'm not wearing anything underneath this---
What the hell did I do last night?
I feel sick.
YES THANK YOU!
Let's just drop it.
What's wrong with Queenie?
I mean she's not hating me.
Her stool? Did you look at it for parasites?
Get some honey from the cookhouse.
Sure Kinko.
Yeah.
How did she die?
August!
Up. Rosie. Up.
Rosie please. My hair hurts.
Does everybody know what happened?
Can somebody tell me?
Finding food? But I don't really know how to do this.
August, there's got to be another way.
Please, August, let me try again.
I'm so sorry girl. Just a few more here. Hold still.
Rosie?
But as soon as the Spec started, we all knew it was too soon for Rosie's debut.
August, she's hurt.
I'm sorry ma'am. I'll get her.
Rosie, no! Stop!
Bad elephant, that's not nice. This kind lady hasn't invited you.
What's in the bucket?
Greg, right? Are you Polish?
Jankowski.
Are you a bull man? August would hire you in a minute.
How's Marlena?
She's in the menagerie.
August! Wait! She was good! She came back on her own! Besides, you can't do anything now! The show is still going on.
AUGUST, NO!
Rosie, what am I going to do with you?
I'm sure that's not true.
She'll be OK.
How's she doing?
Is she drunk?
Just read those out loud. To Rosie.
Daj.
Go on.
I'll get it.
You ever going to let him off the hook?
Rosie's going be great. He won't hurt her again. I know it.
Maybe you should wait for August.
I was doomed.
Are you all right?
Anything.
Why are you saying this?
How can you be with a man you're frightened of?
I'm not that good. And I don't want to be.
No, I don't. Good men don't wind up with much in the end except their goodness. Isn't worth much, is it?
You deserve as good a life any other girl.
I understand.
I already am.
I promise.
If I had money, if I could take care of you, would we be going back?
Have you tried to get away before?
Hey, Camel. What's wrong?
I don't know.
Walter, please. Blackie and his men only patrol the roustabout cars.
He has a son in Pennsylvania. Near Reading. We're playing there in three weeks. That's all he needs.
Good morning.
Well, I want to apologize for--
I don't know. I just ran.
Alone with me, telling her every thing I couldn't tell anyone else, she became the closest thing I had to family.
And August! Ha, August was a new man..
..treating everybody first class, spreading the word his Rosie act would finally get the men paid..
..And with business so strong, nobody was worried about getting tossed, so we didn't have to worry so much about old Camel.
But I didn't trust the new August.
It was when I saw Rosie purring under his touch as if nothing had happened between them, that the worst thought occurred to me.
Maybe, I was the man not to be trusted.
Thank you, August.
Thank you, Marlena.
Sure.
No problem.
Beautiful.
To August!
We should go!
NO! I just don't think you're safe to be around a woman right now.
LET ME GO!! HE'LL KILL HER!!!
HE'S HURTING HER!!LET ME GO!
Why are we moving? We have a matinee tomorrow.
My God. Are you all right?
Because Blackie and his men don't work the performer train and they'll red-light him if they find him. He can't work anymore.
Does August know where you are?
He can't find you. As soon as we stop - before we stop - we'll jump off and I'll take you to a hotel in town.
Marlena, I'm not leaving you. We'll find a way together. I won't let you go back to him. I promise.
..I'll call my dean at Cornell..If I can take my finals again, get my degree, I can get my license.
Don't worry about him.
What do you mean?
Don't you work the matinee?
Marlena!!
Where is she? Did he hurt her?
I have to get Marlena. What if he--
I have to get her.
She's going to have a baby.
We're going to Ringling. Me, Marlena. You can too.
Do whatever you have to, Walter.
Walter? Camel?
WALTER! CAMEL!!
I waited almost til matinee time so I could let myself be seen by as many people from town.
I'm not here to cause any trouble.
I'd like to say goodbye. To the menagerie. Just a few minutes and then I'll go.
I am nothing.
Walter! Is he---?
Why are you telling me?
Earl, what was that?
What is it?
MARLENA!
It took days to round them up. Some we never did get back.
I don't know who was more scared -
When the Nesci Bros. Circus showed, we were officially belly up.
Not all of them! Some of these animals are mine, like this bull.
You don't want her anyway. She can't do anything. Dumb as a box of peanut shells.
Gertrude.
I wish I knew.
I convinced my dean to let me take my finals. Marlena was right. With my degree, our animals and Marlena's acts, Ringling got a sweet deal. Our son was born our first season. We named him Walter.
By the time our third son came, we'd had enough. Rosie was tired.
Luckily, the vet at the Albany Zoo dropped dead, so I got the job.
They're here for me.
You sure about this?
Nah, I'm not running away. Just coming home.
Thank you, Ma'am.
The what?
He's seriously old.
It's OK. We're gonna call the home so they can come pick you up.
Woah! The language. Uncalled for.
You may begin.
Mr. Jankowski? May we have a word?
Jacob, it's your parents. I'm afraid there's been a car accident.
Are you ready?
Is there any other family to call?
I know this is difficult for you, but there's been no mistake. The house and all their assets, including your father's practise, are now property of the bank in default of the mortgage.
they had, instead of money.

Yes, I know, he was a very good man but in banking terms, in the reality of what makes this world actually function, he was an irresponsible man. I'm sorry, but you oughta to know the truth. This Depression is going to last for a long while..
..And the only ones who will be standing at the end of it, are the ones who fight to take what they need to survive. Everyone else is going to disappear. Don't make the same mistakes as your father.
This just came for you, Jacob.
Jacob? Jacob they need these signed by the end of the business day.
Oh, don't go messin with Blackie.
I'm tellin ya, ya can't red light him, we don't need that trouble.
Don't be sore kid. It's more like a reflex with Blackie. I'm Camel..And that there's Grady. And Bill.
We don't need no bums on this train brother. You can get off right now and keep running.
You're pretty young for the rails.
Where you headed?
Hungry? Outta work?
No shame in it. What can you do?
We land in Deposit in the morning.
Oh kid, don't tell me you didn't notice?
What the hell you doing in here?
Gonna try to get you set up with Crazy Joe.
It has been said Crazy Joe went to prison for killing a man who spit into the wind and hit the back of Joe's neck. So no, I would not call this man Crazy Joe to his face.
Hey Joe! I got a First of May here.
You're in, kid.
You like the food? You deserve it.
..Woah, you better take a breath before it all comes back up on ya.
It's an acquired taste. Now get yourself outta there. I'm gonna take you in to see August.
I got a son about your age. Lives outside of Reading, PA. Haven't seen him for years. Fix your shirt there.
Remember, when you meet August let him do the talking and don't ever mention Ringling. He hates them bastards worse than the Depression.
Night ladies.

Now stop right there. That's Marlena. She don't talk to nobody and you don't talk to her. And don't mention her to August. Ain't no right way to talk about somebody's wife and make it sound like a compliment.
I am sorry to hear that.
This here's Earl. He's gonna take you in. Earl, this here's Jacob.
HA! You may not want to after you been on a show long as I have. Good luck to ya, kid.
Ha, this gam of mine keeps falling asleep on me. Pretty soon the only place for me is going to be selling tickets but I'm too ugly for that.
Yeah, take care kid.
Hey kid. What are you doing on the wrong side of the tracks?
Hey kid. How nice to see ya.
No such thing. Is there Doc?
Well what the hell am I supposed to drink to stop the shakes? It's Prohibition and I ain't no Astor.
What happened? Somebody turn me around. Share some of that jug!
Jesus Christ! Who did that to you?
What about family? Like my son.
She sold you?
Stand inside the tent and smack the sides with this when you see a head trying to peek in without paying.
It's OK Camel. Tomorrow's payday.
Ha, he really don't know.
What's wrong with him, doc?
Boonton and Weehawken.
We can't leave him here. They'll red light him for sure.
Baggage stock horses. They pack'em in 27 a car.
What smell?
When Cecil gives the signal ya gotta push the rubes in towards the entrance but without them catching on or else they'll be a fight.
LAAADIIIEEESS AND GENTLEMENNNNN!
SHOW ON EARTH!!!
How's your pipe, kid?
Bring her to my tent, it's closer.
Don't talk.
Night Camel.
Very nice.
That stowaway the old drunk took under his wing. College boy.
MARLENA! JACOB! AUGUST WANTS YOU!
What's going on?
No he won't, kid. Come on.
See, it's over. Can we let you go?
Come on kid.
It's good you're going. They must have known you got back on the train last night. He tossed more than half a dozen working men.
Kinkers never get tossed. Never. So that was meant for you.
A few of the guys that got tossed caught up with us again.
They don't reckon he lasted the night.
The Disaster March!
What's this?
I don't believe I've had the pleasure.
why he is on my train?
Ever worked a show, son?
Ever been to a show?
Ringling, you say?
Really? Have you seen our show?
What was your favorite act?
Ah, our Star Attraction. Well, I believe we're looking for a boy to carry water for the elephants, aren't we Diamond Joe?
Shut-up.
You smell like every kind of shit.
That's beautifully put.
Another sonny boy mad at mommy and daddy for paying the bills. Sounds like he studied poetry.
Earl wait!
Veterinary science?
May I ask what school?
You're a Cornell graduate?
All right, Cornell. Come with me.
Are you sure-footed, Jacob Jankowski?
Good.
COME ON THEN!
It's a breath taking sight, isn't it? Always gets me.
Kinko.
This is Jacob. He's going to bunk with you a while.
I said his name is Jacob.
He's going to help out in the menagerie.
Well there are performers..
And then there are performers..
I'll find you in the morning. Sleep well, Cornell.
Jacob!
You'll need new clothes too. I'll set you up with the Monday Man.
What day of the week did your mother hang out the wash to dry?
It's the Depression, Cornell. Where have you been? Oh right - Cornell.
Here, use Kinko's second bucket for now.
You barely use up one.
If you need a razor, there are some back there with my name on them.
It's good to have an educated man like you around. I need one other sane individual in this operation.
The horse.
I'm sure it's nothing serious.
Darling, meet Jacob Jankowski, Benzini Brothers own veterinarian.
Last stall. Lead the way, doc.
Jesus, Marlena, he wasn't this bad in the show.
Is that the problem?
Do you need any hoof testers?
Well, how are you going to fix it?
English.
I know you are. Come with me.
Jacob and I'll take care of the cats. We'll meet you back at the stall.
Grab the other bucket, will you?
No, they really love goats.
We're all out of goats.
Go ahead. They get a bucket each.
Unless you think a formal sit-down is appropriate.
WAIT!
Not that one, that one.
What's the matter? Didn't they cover this in school?
Yes I do! Aw Jacob wait! Don't be sore! I was having a little fun!

..people want their money back when the Star Act on the poster isn't in the ring! A Star Attraction keeps a circus alive. Without it, animals eat that and men eat nothing. It takes time to find and train another horse so without Silver Star, I have no Star Act.
Like this?

We always have choices, Jacob - a choice between our pain and someone else's. That horse was performing before you came and he will continue to perform until he drops dead. I'm telling you to keep it alive and that's what you'll do or you'll be red lit like anyone else who doesn't obey the law here.
You've got a gift for them. Like Marlena with horses. It's God-
He must have been a wise man.
You're not going anywhere. You belong here. These animals..they've been waiting for you.
I do thank you though. You and Silver Star solved a much bigger problem for me.
The cats. You see, meat eaters are always more valuable to a circus than hay burners. And you saw what we had to feed them.
We have a new star!
Nah, lousy Ringling got here first.
A bull elephant! Her name is Rosie, she's fifty-three and she's brilliant. The best bull they had.
We'll find places for everyone. And when our new star sells tickets, we'll buy another car! We're a show to be reckoned with now!
Darling, what do you think? She's magnificent, isn't she?
No.
This is my menagerie man.
Here he is. He's my bull man..
I don't believe it. The mayor said she was the best bull you had.
Joe, you and Greg come with me. We have to find a car to renovate.
See what you can do with her.
Get rid of him. He comes back on my property, you can shoot him.
JACOB! Come in, come in!
Darling, our guest has arrived.
We can fix that, can't we darling?
so she can start selling tickets.
So tomorrow, my faithful bull man, we begin! But tonight - we dine!!
Ta-dah!
Thank you my love.
From now on I shall trust your judgement in all things veterinarian. Please say you accept my apology.
Good man!
I could truly use a friend I can trust.
BAH! A worthless piece of paper from the ivy bush league! Of course you're a vet. You have the gift.
All right, let me ask you - do you honestly think this is the most spectacular show on earth?

No. It's nowhere near. Lucinda, our Fat Lady, isn't 800 pounds. Four at the tops. And you really think the Tattooed Man got tattooed by headhunters in Borneo? He's from Pittsburgh. Took him nine years to ink himself. And you know what I did when the hippo died? Swapped out her water for formaldehyde and kept showing her. For two weeks, we travelled with a pickled hippo..
..The world is run on tricks - in here and out there. So trust me, it's having a talent that counts.
To talent and illusion!
To all we love.
Come on Jacob! It's customary to sing for your supper!
We got big trouble. Lucinda died.
I don't care where you find one, but find one.
Better get some kind of rig set up to lift her out of the car. How did you carry Silver Star out?
No, no, of course, don't be silly!
You just can't get enough of somebody in your pants, can you?
Yes.
I'm opening the midway and the menagerie this afternoon for some extra cash before the show tomorrow night. We'll see how she does with the crowd. She got any skills?
Well, first of all, you can't do anything with a bull without the bull hook.
It's the only way to train them.
We don't have the time! She has to start earning her keep MOVE! UP!
Don't tell me my business! You don't want to watch this, get the hell out! Making love to it ain't going to work. Besides, from what I hear, you're not that good at it.
GET UP! UP!!!
MOVE! MOVE!
I'm here, darling, I've got you.
Jacob, send Joe for ice. You go and find that Goddamn bull before we're run out town. And take the hook!
A little shaky. Sore wrists.
Good.
Good. The band will drown it out.
Get her out of here! NOW!
Do you know where Marlena is? Did she send you?
Thank you. My friend.
Jacob?
What were you planning to do with that bull hook?
Ha. You look like me.
Maybe there is someone who understands me.
Everything's fine, Earl.
Do tylu, Rosie! Do tylu!
We've got a new star!
Would you like to dance, darling?
We need more champagne.
No, you stay with Marlena.
I slept like a baby after last night. Thank you my darling.
Ah, nothing to be ashamed of. Man and wife reuniting in the most sacred of marriage places.
My Marlena has forgiven me. All's well with the world again, right Jacob?
That was quite an adventure last night. I'm glad I didn't have to bail you out. How did you get home?
How did you two get separated? You were so close on the dance floor.
The circus is nothing without it's traditions..

..It's a family. And like any family, when a new member is born, it's arrival must be greeted with celebration and gratitude. Now, we've been a little busy with sold out performances, thank the Gods..
..but right now I want to take this moment before today's show to gather together..We close our eyes..
..and we thank whoever's up there that sends desperate men running for the rails..
..because it was a lucky day when Jacob Jankowski jumped our train.
..And we give him the traditional Benzini Brothers baptism.
Now you don't have to borrow mine.
It's from both of us.
What is this?
Did you show Jacob the opening night present I gave you?
It looks stunning on you.
Many thanks. Forgive me for arriving too soon and spoiling the surprise.
I'm sorry. I'm probably wrong. I assumed that night after the RAID was the first time you two fucked, but obviously it's been going on longer than that.
Did you think I didn't know?
Shut-up. SHUT UP!
How long did you think you could keep this from me?
GO ON! INTERRUPT ME ONE MORE TIME!
A woman? This is not a woman. This is my wife you Ivy League lying piece of shit! Say, I bet the authorities would like to know you practise without a license.
I see you. I see you too clearly.
YOU DON'T EVEN DENY IT! LOUSY  TRAMP!!
Funny, I thought you already left.
Earl, take him to the menagerie.
YOU! YOU DID THIS!!
We don't have an eleph-
Marlena did want a vet to take a look at Silver Star. They cost.
A harness what?
The Man and a Half?
She's a hundred if she's a day.
In pieces.
I got no use for people who rhyme.
He shovelled horse shit. Don't make him a horse doctor.
Just for the elephant! But the bunkers are at capacity! I've got roustabouts three to a bunk.
He worked the rubes for me this afternoon. Pretty good.
August.
What is he?
I asked what, not who.
A menagerie man? Performers don't bunk with working men.
Queenie attack.
What do you think you're doing?
August loves his sideshow freaks.
Went belly up. Pretty common nowadays. Circus bosses see the end coming and they'd pull a runner with all the money. Menagerie belongs to the town now. August can get anything he wants for a song.
Most of them will never belong to another show. And they know it.
Queenie stop.
It's trouble, that's what. Not that I give a damn, but you're playing with dynamite with those two and you're gonna blow all of us up.
You don't get it, do you? When August feeds your arm to a lion -
Six men got red lit last night.
He hid one of the men who was supposed to be tossed. Word was the train was over a trestle instead of land. Nobody comes back from that.
JACOB MY FRIEND!! Folks, this is my friend and roommate Jacob. I'd like you all to make him feel at home!
Where are you right now or where are you in an Aristotelean context because right now you're in a trunk.
Huh-huh.
You look a little pale.
Your balls itchy?
It'll grow back. Aw come on, you still store about last night? Now I figure we're even. In fact, I probably owe you one. Feel free to borrow a book.
Yeah, she's been like this all day.
I don't like looking at my own.
Jacob?
Thanks.
Jacob?
My real name's Walter.
Tell me the truth. What's wrong with him?
And if he rests?
Then you have to put him down.
But August won't let you.
But August won't like it.
No. I'll keep him calm.
I'll be sorry to see you go, Mr.
And please, call me Marlena. I'm not a snob like everybody thinks.
I think you two are engaged.
I think Rosie likes music. That harmonica song is lovely.
What?
Beat. Jacob tries not to laugh. They return to stroking Rosie, trying not to look at each other.
I'm so glad you could come. Would you like a beer? Or champagne?
People don't realize how much August does holding everything together. How difficult it is in these times. The whole company is like a family to him.
And Silver Star.
Darling. Darling, please..
Gently. We have a guest.
Darling, what is it?
You don't know your own strength, my love.
Auggie?
Excuse me, Jacob.
Oh yes. He's just had too much to drink, that's all. I hope you had a good time tonight. I wanted so much to make things up to you.

Oh Auggie wanted it too, he felt horrible about what happened. He really does like you Jacob. But it's hard for him. He's under a lot of pressure. He does more than people realize holding things together.
One dance before you go?
Jankowski is Polish isn't it?
There was a parade for the circus.
Ha, you too, huh?
It's a wonderful lie, isn't it?
But he said he'd make me a Star Attraction and he did. I'm pretty lucky he found me.
You're sweet to say so.
Etting. She's one of my favorites.
Are you much of a wine drinker?
Maybe you should go to bed.
Good night.
Jacob!
No, thank you.
Hook? That's an unfortunate choice of words.
Jacob, what you know about August is pretty much nothing.
He'll never change.
I want to dance.
I want to dance now!
I want to see the Empire State Building.
I don't know where he is, do you?
I've never seen so far. Have you?
Look at it. As far as the eye can see and it's nowhere near all that's out there.
Sorry.
Jacob? I need you to do something for me. Promise me you will.
I want you to go. I want you get away from us, from the show. You're smart Jacob. You deserve better than us. Leave as soon as you can or something terrible's going to happen.
It's all right. No one can hear.
Nothing can ever happen with us, you know. It's too dangerous.
There's nothing that can cause a woman so much trouble as a good man.
Don't say that.
Sweet Jacob.
Am I still a girl? I feel so old.
This can only be tonight. We have to go back. Promise me you understand.
Promise me you'll suffer.
Promise you'll look in my eyes the whole time.
Jacob you promised. You said you understood it was only tonight.
Where were you when I was 17?
Good morning Jacob, how are you?
About what? Is something wrong?
Oh Jacob, champagne completely overwhelms my senses..I always feel the better for it when I abstain.
Ha,ha Jacob, it's silly of you to apologize for my torn stockings.
August, please. We're in public.
I told you, sweetheart. We got pushed apart by the crowd. This older married couple brought me to the ferry.
You're welcome, Jacob.
I wonder if you could help me.
I've planned a surprise for August.
Oh, he'll be here any second.
To August - an authentic miracle man because he made a star attraction out of me.
Don't be silly. I couldn't wait for you to come.
What?
Auggie, you're being silly.
August don't do this!
August, please, there's nothing-
STOP IT!..AUGGIE STOP IT..PLEASE!
Jacob? Jacob, it's Marlena.
I'm sorry. I had nowhere to go. I told him I'm leaving him.
Looks worse than it feels.
Can I have a swig of that?
Why are you hiding that roustabout?
My God.
No. He thinks I'm with Barbara and the girls. He won't go there.
And after that? August has all our money. Where will I go?
Oh Jacob, that would be wonderful.
I'm so tired.
What happens now?
Louis Armstrong. Right.
You better before she gets at my --

Characters.Character: ARE YOU CRAZY TALKING TO AN

Replies.Reply: ELEPHANT!? SHOOT IT! BEFORE IT EATS  MY HOUSE! I'M CALLING THE POLICE!
Gin and ginger ale. Elephants love booze. One whiff of this and she's not thinking about cabbages no more.
Grabowski.
Don't want the job. Not for him.
Is she following?
Here this will help. Poor beast. He really hurt her. Told you about him.
Don't understand why a man like that wants to be around animals in the first place. He shouldn't have the right, if you ask me.
Oh she's a strong one, this one.
Jestes dobra dziewczynka Jacob watches as Rosie lifts her foot and Greg rubs ointment.
She's four tons..she'll just sleep good.
Potoz noge.
Masz, moja piekna Jacob watches as Greg digs in his pocket and pulls out a mint, brushing off the lint. Rosie's trunk investigates, then nimbly plucks it out of his hand and into her mouth.
Might help if he said please.
JACOB! IT'S THE MENAGERIE!! THE  ANIMALS ARE LOOSE.
He's right. He's just an elephant tramp. The bull is his.
Jacob is asleep under Rosie when Walter wakes him up.
Why are you sleeping here?
Jamaica ginger paralysis.
The manufacturer started putting this plasticizer in it, or something, to get around regulations that Jamaica ginger extract not be sold as booze.
You're not supposed to drink this stuff, ya know.
NO! NO!
Until when? What are we going to do with him? Shoot him like Silver Star? Because that's what he is Jacob. In a week, he won't be able to move his legs at all.
I shouldn't be a clown. I should be a Goddamn fortune teller.
Come on Jacob. Walk away.
The only thing that's keeping you alive right now are the rubes who saw everything. August can't risk getting rid of you here. But you better not get back on this train when we leave tomorrow night.
Shut-up Camel.
August.
Is it true?
Something's gone wrong.
Why is the train moving?
Aw girl. We're all in it now.
Sshh. Lie back.
I don't know. Your pupils are two different sizes.
Jacob, look at me. You've got a concussion and you're on a moving train. There's nothing you can do.
Jacob, you can't.
Does August know?
What have you done to us?
I'm a fifth rate clown when second rate circuses are folding all over the place. Doesn't put me on top of Ringling's list. They've got a dozen of me in the wings. I couldn't even go if I wanted to.
Not a woman I have any use for.
I'm not exactly cut out for farm work. Don't worry about me..
You too, Jacob.
Not today. I'm fading. I gotta re-
Do you have any proof?
What's her name?
Gertrude! Gertrude, step up! UP!
Yes, I'm hoping you can. An elderly gentleman went missing from the nursing home down the street. Staff seems to think he came here.
Excuse me, but who is that?
OK, well, thanks for your time.
